trans-unit.source: <properties pageTitle="User Profile data in Azure RemoteApp" description="Learn how user data is stored and accessed in Azure RemoteApp" services="remoteapp" documentationCenter="" authors="lizap" manager="mbaldwin" />
trans-unit.target: <properties pageTitle="User Profile data in Azure RemoteApp" description="Learn how user data is stored and accessed in Azure RemoteApp" services="remoteapp" documentationCenter="" authors="lizap" manager="mbaldwin" />

trans-unit.source: <tags ms.service="remoteapp" ms.workload="compute" ms.tgt_pltfrm="na" ms.devlang="na" ms.topic="article" ms.date="08/12/2015" ms.author="elizapo" />
trans-unit.target: <tags ms.service="remoteapp" ms.workload="compute" ms.tgt_pltfrm="na" ms.devlang="na" ms.topic="article" ms.date="08/12/2015" ms.author="elizapo" />

trans-unit.source: Azure RemoteApp saves user identity and customizations across devices and sessions.
trans-unit.target: Azure RemoteApp saves user identity and customizations across devices and sessions.

trans-unit.source: This user data is stored in a per-user per-collection disk, known as a user profile disk (UPD).
trans-unit.target: This user data is stored in a per-user per-collection disk, known as a user profile disk (UPD).

trans-unit.source: The disk follows the user and ensures the user has a consistent experience, regardless of where they sign in.
trans-unit.target: The disk follows the user and ensures the user has a consistent experience, regardless of where they sign in.

trans-unit.source: saves
trans-unit.target: saves

trans-unit.source: User profile disks are completely transparent to the user — users save documents to their Documents folder (on what appears to be a local drive) and change their app settings as usual.
trans-unit.target: User profile disks are completely transparent to the user — users save documents to their Documents folder (on what appears to be a local drive) and change their app settings as usual.

trans-unit.source: At the same time, all personal settings persist when connecting to Azure RemoteApp from any device.
trans-unit.target: At the same time, all personal settings persist when connecting to Azure RemoteApp from any device.

trans-unit.source: All the user sees is their data in the same place.
trans-unit.target: All the user sees is their data in the same place.

trans-unit.source: Each UPD has 50GB of persistent storage and contains both user data and application settings.
trans-unit.target: Each UPD has 50GB of persistent storage and contains both user data and application settings.

trans-unit.source: Read on for specifics on user profile data.
trans-unit.target: Read on for specifics on user profile data.

trans-unit.source: If you need to access the data for one of your users (for disaster recovery or if the user leaves the company), contact <linkText>Azure RemoteApp</linkText><title></title> and provide the subscription information for the collection and the user identity.
trans-unit.target: If you need to access the data for one of your users (for disaster recovery or if the user leaves the company), contact <linkText>Azure RemoteApp</linkText><title></title> and provide the subscription information for the collection and the user identity.

trans-unit.source: The Azure RemoteApp team will provide you a URL where you can access the data - from there you can browse the location and retrieve any documents or files you need.
trans-unit.target: The Azure RemoteApp team will provide you a URL where you can access the data - from there you can browse the location and retrieve any documents or files you need.

trans-unit.source: Yes, we save a backup of the user data per geographic location.
trans-unit.target: Yes, we save a backup of the user data per geographic location.

trans-unit.source: The data is read-only and can be accessed in the same way as the regular data would be (contact Azure RemoteApp to get), if the primary data center is down.
trans-unit.target: The data is read-only and can be accessed in the same way as the regular data would be (contact Azure RemoteApp to get), if the primary data center is down.

trans-unit.source: Each user will have their own directory on the server that maps to their UPD: c:\Users\username.
trans-unit.target: Each user will have their own directory on the server that maps to their UPD: c:\Users\username.

trans-unit.source: Azure RemoteApp saves the Outlook state (mailboxes, PSTs) between sessions. To enable this, we need the PST to be stored in the user profile data (c:\users\<username>). This is the default location for the data, so as long as you do not change the location, the data will persist between sessions.
trans-unit.target: Azure RemoteApp saves the Outlook state (mailboxes, PSTs) between sessions. To enable this, we need the PST to be stored in the user profile data (c:\users\<username>). This is the default location for the data, so as long as you do not change the location, the data will persist between sessions.

trans-unit.source: We also recommend that you use "cached" mode in Outlook and use "server/online" mode for searching.
trans-unit.target: We also recommend that you use "cached" mode in Outlook and use "server/online" mode for searching.

trans-unit.source: Yes, Azure RemoteApp supports using shared data solutions - particularly OneDrive for Business and Dropbox.
trans-unit.target: Yes, Azure RemoteApp supports using shared data solutions - particularly OneDrive for Business and Dropbox.

trans-unit.source: Note, however, that OneDrive Consumer (the personal version) and Box are not supported.
trans-unit.target: Note, however, that OneDrive Consumer (the personal version) and Box are not supported.

trans-unit.source: You can configure Azure RemoteApp to let users access local devices by setting up <linkText>redirection</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: You can configure Azure RemoteApp to let users access local devices by setting up <linkText>redirection</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Local devices will then be able to access the data on the UPD.
trans-unit.target: Local devices will then be able to access the data on the UPD.

trans-unit.source: No, because the UPD is not persistent.
trans-unit.target: No, because the UPD is not persistent.

trans-unit.source: A UPD is only available when the user is actively connected to Azure RemoteApp.
trans-unit.target: A UPD is only available when the user is actively connected to Azure RemoteApp.

trans-unit.source: No, when you delete a user, we do not automatically delete the UPD - instead, we store the data until you delete the collection.
trans-unit.target: No, when you delete a user, we do not automatically delete the UPD - instead, we store the data until you delete the collection.

trans-unit.source: 90 days after you delete the collection, we delete all UPDs.
trans-unit.target: 90 days after you delete the collection, we delete all UPDs.

trans-unit.source: If you need to delete a UPD from a collection, contact Azure RemoteApp - we can delete UPD from our side.
trans-unit.target: If you need to delete a UPD from a collection, contact Azure RemoteApp - we can delete UPD from our side.

trans-unit.source: Yes, if you contact <linkText>Azure RemoteApp</linkText><title></title>, we can set you up with a URL to access the data.
trans-unit.target: Yes, if you contact <linkText>Azure RemoteApp</linkText><title></title>, we can set you up with a URL to access the data.

trans-unit.source: You'll have about 10 hours to download any data or files from the UPD before the access expires.
trans-unit.target: You'll have about 10 hours to download any data or files from the UPD before the access expires.

trans-unit.source: Right now we do not provide offline access to UPDs, beyond the 10 hour access window described above.
trans-unit.target: Right now we do not provide offline access to UPDs, beyond the 10 hour access window described above.

trans-unit.source: This means that we do not currently have a way to provide you with access for long enough to complete more complicated tasks, like running anti-virus software on the UPDs or accessing data for an audit.
trans-unit.target: This means that we do not currently have a way to provide you with access for long enough to complete more complicated tasks, like running anti-virus software on the UPDs or accessing data for an audit.

trans-unit.source: Yes, you can ask Azure RemoteApp to disable UPDs for a subscription, but you cannot do that yourself.
trans-unit.target: Yes, you can ask Azure RemoteApp to disable UPDs for a subscription, but you cannot do that yourself.

trans-unit.source: This means that UPDs will be disabled for all collections in the subscription.
trans-unit.target: This means that UPDs will be disabled for all collections in the subscription.

trans-unit.source: Yes, but you'll need to set that up in the template image before you create the collection.
trans-unit.target: Yes, but you'll need to set that up in the template image before you create the collection.

trans-unit.source: Use the following steps to block access to the system drive:
trans-unit.target: Use the following steps to block access to the system drive:

trans-unit.source: Run gpedit.msc on the template image.
trans-unit.target: Run gpedit.msc on the template image.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to User Configuration > Administrative Templates > Windows Components > Explorer.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to User Configuration > Administrative Templates > Windows Components > Explorer.

trans-unit.source: Select the following options:
trans-unit.target: Select the following options:

trans-unit.source: Hide these specified drives in My Computer
trans-unit.target: Hide these specified drives in My Computer

trans-unit.source: Prevent access to drives from My Computer
trans-unit.target: Prevent access to drives from My Computer

trans-unit.source: Yes, when you create the template image, you can add information to the default profile.
trans-unit.target: Yes, when you create the template image, you can add information to the default profile.

trans-unit.source: That information is then added to the UPD.
trans-unit.target: That information is then added to the UPD.

trans-unit.source: No, all UPDs have 50 GB of storage.
trans-unit.target: No, all UPDs have 50 GB of storage.

trans-unit.source: If you want to store different amounts of data, try the following:
trans-unit.target: If you want to store different amounts of data, try the following:

trans-unit.source: Disable UPDs for the collection.
trans-unit.target: Disable UPDs for the collection.

trans-unit.source: Set up a file share for users to access.
trans-unit.target: Set up a file share for users to access.

trans-unit.source: Load the file share by using a startup script.
trans-unit.target: Load the file share by using a startup script.

trans-unit.source: See below for details on startup scripts in Azure RemoteApp.
trans-unit.target: See below for details on startup scripts in Azure RemoteApp.

trans-unit.source: Direct users to save all data to the file share.
trans-unit.target: Direct users to save all data to the file share.

trans-unit.source: You can also use data synchronization apps like OneDrive for Business.
trans-unit.target: You can also use data synchronization apps like OneDrive for Business.

trans-unit.source: If you want to run a startup script, start by creating a scheduled task in the template image you are going to use for the collection.
trans-unit.target: If you want to run a startup script, start by creating a scheduled task in the template image you are going to use for the collection.

trans-unit.source: (Do this before you run sysprep.)
trans-unit.target: (Do this before you run sysprep.)

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create a system task</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create a system task</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create a system task that runs when a user logs on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create a system task that runs when a user logs on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The scheduled task will launch your startup script, using the user's credentials.
trans-unit.target: The scheduled task will launch your startup script, using the user's credentials.

trans-unit.source: Schedule the task to run every a time a user logs on.
trans-unit.target: Schedule the task to run every a time a user logs on.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Set the trigger for the task as "At log on"</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Set the trigger for the task as "At log on"</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can also use <linkText>Group Policy-based startup scripts</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: You can also use <linkText>Group Policy-based startup scripts</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In other words, can I create a .bat file that runs a config window script and save it to the c:\ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\StartUp folder, and then have that script run whenever a user starts a RemoteApp session?
trans-unit.target: In other words, can I create a .bat file that runs a config window script and save it to the c:\ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\StartUp folder, and then have that script run whenever a user starts a RemoteApp session?

trans-unit.source: No, that's not supported with Azure RemoteApp, which uses RDSH, which also does not support startup scripts in the Start menu.
trans-unit.target: No, that's not supported with Azure RemoteApp, which uses RDSH, which also does not support startup scripts in the Start menu.

trans-unit.source: Nope, not supported by Azure RemoteApp.
trans-unit.target: Nope, not supported by Azure RemoteApp.
